content.html:
Two and a half weeks?! Ryan, that’s just no good. What’s your deal, man? Why are you being suck a slacker?

This is the obligatory “Sorry, I’ve been busy” post as made famous by Dan Rubin, Todd Dominey, and Adam Polselli.

Every time that I’ve come across something cool lately, my boss has handed me another 5 hours of work that is due in three. Everytime, I’ve gone to work on Feed Parser, or Blocker, or Blogroller, my wife says “Time for dinner!” Everytime I’ve gone to sit down and experiment with unexplored features of CSS (for my upcoming redesign with the Longhorn-esque timeline), I realize that if I don’t leave right away, I’ll miss my train and be late for work.

Weekends haven’t been that much better either since I’ve either been out of town or watching my friend’s kids for a few hours while they’re at work, or I’ve been trying to get through disc 1 of 3 in Final Fantasy VII.

I’ve got to figure out how to re-work my schedule so I’ve got a little more room. Spending over 3 hours a day either on or waiting for the train as been a huge loss of time. Of course my iPod and Final Fantasy Tactics Advance for GBA-SP have helped the boredom issue, but I’ll be able to do more once I can finally afford to get my laptop.

content.source:
> Two and a half weeks?! Ryan, that’s just no good. What’s your deal, man? Why are you being suck a slacker?

This is the obligatory “Sorry, I’ve been busy” post as made famous by [Dan Rubin]({{% wayback "http://www.superfluousbanter.org" %}}), [Todd Dominey]({{% wayback "http://www.whatdoiknow.org" %}}), and [Adam Polselli]({{% wayback "http://www.adampolselli.com/" %}}).

Every time that I’ve come across something cool lately, my boss has handed me another 5 hours of work that is due in three. Everytime, I’ve gone to work on [Feed Parser](/projects/feedparser/), or [Blocker](/projects/blocker/), or [Blogroller](/projects/blogroller/), my wife says “Time for dinner!” Everytime I’ve gone to sit down and experiment with unexplored features of CSS (for my [upcoming redesign](/archives/000181.php) with the Longhorn-esque timeline), I realize that if I don’t leave right away, I’ll miss my train and be late for work.

Weekends haven’t been that much better either since I’ve either been out of town or watching my friend’s kids for a few hours while they’re at work, or I’ve been trying to get through disc 1 of 3 in [Final Fantasy VII]({{% wayback "http://www.ffonline.com/ff7/" %}}).

I’ve got to figure out how to re-work my schedule so I’ve got a little more room. Spending over 3 hours a day either on or waiting for the train as been a huge loss of time. Of course my [iPod]({{% wayback "http://www.apple.com/ipod/" %}}) and [Final Fantasy Tactics Advance]({{% wayback "http://www.square-enix-usa.com/games/FFT-A/" %}}) for [GBA-SP]({{% wayback "http://www.nintendo.com/systemsgba" %}}) have helped the boredom issue, but I’ll be able to do more once I can finally afford to get [my laptop]({{% wayback "http://www.apple.com/powerbook/" %}}).
